docs.lead_paragraph: No State of the Union is richer mineral spritgs than is New-York. Nor can any boast greater variety of these fountains of health, for we have them in abundance-warm or cold, sulphurous, saline, alks. line, chalybeate, acidulous or aperient. The fame of Saratoga as a resort for fashionable seekers after health and pleasure is world-wide.

docs.lead_paragraph: UNITARIANISM IN TRANSYLVANIA.--The American Unitarian Association have recently been paying special attention to the necessities of their brethren in Transylvania, and an appropriation has been made in their behalf from the Association's funds. The number of Unitarians in that country is estimated at 47,000, and their form of service is the same as that maintained in all Protestant dissenting churches.

headline.main: A Remarkable Will-Freaks of a Testator.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Worcester (Mass) Spy. We had the curiosity to examine, a few days since, the last will and testament of the late JESSE W. GOODRICH, for many years an attorney at law, and editor of a newspaper in this city, entitled the Cataract, devoted to the temperance reform, who has recently deceased. Mr. GOODRICH was a bachelor,

headline.main: FROM KANSAS.; Origin of the Present Difficulty ADDRESS TO THE PEOPLE---PROSPECTS. THE NEW ENTANGLEMENT AFFAIRS IN LAWRENCE.. THE NEW ENTANGLEMENTT THE CHARTER.

docs.lead_paragraph: A series of events is now transpiring in Lawrence which, ultimately, must have a decisive effect on our present difficulties, and which will either ensure or ruin the success of Governor WALKER in his effect to restore Peace and harmony to this Tex

docs.lead_paragraph: Lieut. GEO. M. TOTTEN, of the United States Navy, died at Mendham, N. J., on Saturday last. Lieut. TOTTEN had been in the Navy for a period of about thirty years, during which time, up to the commencement of his last illness, he was actively employed.

headline.main: Trial of the Parties who Boarded a Quarantied Vessel.; COURT OF SPECIAL SESSIONS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Justices Osborne and Connotly. The Court-room was very full, and so was the calendar. The assault and battery and petit larceny cases were about equal in number. One or two cases were brought before the Court, of a nature too disgusting for publication. Seven men pleaded guilty to a violation of the Quarantine law, and will be sentenced on Saturday.
